abstract: All six members of Rondon family in Bushwick survive fire that destroyed their apartment building, displacing at least 35 families, but experience firsthand  difficulty of life in days, or even weeks, after disaster when critical forms of identification are left behind; interviews with survivors of Bushwick fire underscore challenges in finding housing, services and even cash without necessary documentation like driver's licenses, birth certificates or passports.
lead_paragraph: The blaze put at least 35 families out of their homes, leaving many to deal with a maze of agencies and hotels as they sought to replace what they lost.

headline.main: They Survived a Brooklyn Fire. Then a New Ordeal Began.
headline.print_headline: Fleeing a Brooklyn Fire, Only to Be Confronted With Another Ordeal

snippet: The blaze put at least 35 families out of their homes, leaving many to deal with a maze of agencies and hotels as they sought to replace what they lost.

keywords.value: Department of Housing Preservation and Development (NYC)
keywords.name: organizations
